designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
designations.comments: Large reduction in hectads, though possibly under-recorded as it is nocturnal. There are recent records from eastern England which are not on NBN, but the lack of records from previously known areas such as the Orkneys suggests there is a real and highly significant decline.Therefore, although the total of 11 post-1990 hectads is likely to be an over-estimate and VU status is appropriate rather than NT.
